intro: Helodeaster, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its striking, often blue or purple, ray flowers that resemble the petals of a holly plant. The plants are typically found in coastal regions and are adapted to salty, well-drained soils. Helodeaster species are perennial herbs that often have a rosette of leaves at the base. Their unique floral structure and ecological adaptations make them interesting subjects for botanical study.
